betterquesting.name: Pulse Confirmation
betterquesting.desc: Confirm that you have a pulse.

betterquesting.name: Let's Tinker
betterquesting.desc: Create the basics on the way to becoming a master tinkerer.

betterquesting.name: Early Game Power
betterquesting.desc:
For this quest, craft either the Actually Additions Coal Generator §cOR§0 the RFTools Coal Generator.
§cYou do not need to craft both.§0

Perfect for powering a few early game machines, but it won't sustain you for long.

betterquesting.name: Coal Conversion
betterquesting.desc: The coke oven is a 3x3x3 multiblock that turns coal into coal coke. To form the multiblock, right-click the center block, on the front face, with the Engineer's Hammer.

betterquesting.name: Atomic Reconstructor
betterquesting.desc: The Atomic Reconstructor can be a very useful tool, especially in the early game. Check the recipes and see for yourself.

betterquesting.name: Steel the Show
betterquesting.desc: The Blast Furnace is the only option for creating steel in the beginning, but as you progress, you'll find quicker methods.

betterquesting.name: New Blaze Powder Method
betterquesting.desc: Scientists have recently discovered that using your Atomic Reconstructor on Orange Dye yields Blaze Powder. Now, don't get to excited as there is no way to create Blaze Rods from Blaze Powder. This is still a wonderful way to get your hands on Blaze Powder in the early game, though.

betterquesting.name: Like a Record Baby
betterquesting.desc:
For this quest, craft either the Windmill §cOR§0 the Waterwheel. §cYou do not need to craft both.§0

Choose your flavor of passive power.

betterquesting.name: Metal Press
betterquesting.desc: This is a much more efficient way of creating metal plates, wouldn't you agree? Anything this press can make can be made more efficiently with the press than it can be with standard crafting. It is definitely a worth while investment.

betterquesting.name: The Tinkerer's Smeltery
betterquesting.desc:
This neat multiblock structure is a must have for an early game tinkerer. Don't skimp on the materials because starting off with at least a 3x3 smeltery will make tinkering much easier in the long run.

The smeltery is great not only because it lets you create better tools, because it also produces more material from ores than a standard furnace. To be exact, you will get 1.5 ingots per ore smelted in the smeltery. Awesome, huh?

betterquesting.name: From a Tinkerer to an Engineer
betterquesting.desc: You'll need this aesthetically pleasing workbench in order to make components for more complex engineering projects. Keep in mind, that you'll also need a Blueprint in order to craft anything.

betterquesting.name: Gardening like an Engineer
betterquesting.desc: The Garden Cloche allows you to have full control over your crops. It is great for any kind of farming.

betterquesting.name: Alloy Kiln
betterquesting.desc: Tired of having to smelt all of your ingots down to make an alloy? Well stop smelting! Now, just throw your ingots into this handy-dandy 2x2x2 multiblock and out will pop your desired alloy. $2.99 Shipping and handling.

betterquesting.name: More Passive Generation
betterquesting.desc: Passive generation is great for the mid-game! Why waste resources if you don't need to? Go ahead, make yourself a Thermo-electric generator, and thank me later.

betterquesting.name: Power Storage
betterquesting.desc:
At this point in the game, you may find that you're producing a little bit more power than you're using. If this is the case, then you, my friend, need an RFTool's Powercell! The way you make a Powercell is by crafting Immersive Engineering's HV Capacitor, and then you throw the HV Capacitor in front of an Atomic Reconstructor. Check out JEI if there is any confusion. 

Don't you just hate it when quests force you to make every single level of something, even though you can probably just afford to make the top tier of that thing? Well, I'm not that kind of pack maker. Here ya go, just make the HV capacitor. Don't concern yourself with LV or MV. You're welcome.

betterquesting.name: Get to tha Crushah!!!- Wait, NO!!!
betterquesting.desc: The IE Crusher is a big multiblock structure that allows you to crush metals rather quickly.

betterquesting.name: Say Hello to Botania
betterquesting.desc: To get started with Botania, you're going to need to grab some mystical flowers from around the world. Ideally, you would want to collect every color, but to get started, the only flower you really need is the Mystical White Flower.

betterquesting.name: Botania's Basics
betterquesting.desc:
The Petal Apothecary is where you will be making your flowers. The first flower you're going to want to make is the Pure Daisy; this flower creates Livingrock out of stone placed around it and Livingwood out of wood logs placed around it.

The Mana Pool is where mana is stored. Mana is placed into Mana Pools by Mana Spreaders. Mana Spreaders get their Mana from generating flowers. All of this info, and more, can be found in the Lexica Botania.

betterquesting.name: Rune Creation
betterquesting.desc: The runic altar creates runes by utilizing mana bursts from a Mana Spreader. Runes are your gateway to Botania's middle tier items. See the Lexica Botania if you need more information.

betterquesting.name: Hemp
betterquesting.desc: Grow hemp now, thank me later. Hemp seeds can be obtained by breaking grass.

betterquesting.name: Iron Fi Fo Fum
betterquesting.desc: Get it?

betterquesting.name: Mana can't stop Steeling
betterquesting.desc: But don't call me no klepto

betterquesting.name: Give me an O!!- ack Nevermind
Okay, This Armor is Getting Quite Pricey
Thermal Machine Frame
betterquesting.desc: This frame is your gateway to basically any machine, so have fun machining it up.

betterquesting.name: Embers
betterquesting.desc:
Embers is another great early game mod. To get started with it, you're going to want an Ancient Codex. To get this item, you'll need to kill Ancient Golems, which can be found in small structures scattered around the world, underground and above ground. The structures are pretty unique, so they're hard to miss.

Because the golems are slow, you may think they're not a threat, but be careful as they have a lot of HP and hit rather hard. They also shoot the occasional projectile, so watch out for that too.

betterquesting.name: Powah!!! Unlimited Powah!!!
betterquesting.desc: The Empowerer uses RF to empower certain items. Crafting ingredients go on the Display Stands, which should be separated from the Empowerer by 2 blocks on each side. Power gets connected to the Display Stands, but the Empowerer itself does not need to be connected to power.

betterquesting.name: Better than my Tractor
betterquesting.desc: This bad boy can automatically farm crops for you! Very handy indeed. If you need more information, refer to the Actually Additions manual, which can be found in JEI when viewing the recipe/uses for any Actually Additions item.

betterquesting.name: Miner?! I Hardly Know Her!
betterquesting.desc:
Vertical Digger... I wonder what it does...

If you're not sure what this does, refer to the Actually Additions manual.

betterquesting.name: Spooky Booster
betterquesting.desc: The Phantom Booster can increase the radius of your Vertical Digger. You can place up to 3 of them on top of the digger.

betterquesting.name: Infuse Those Metals
betterquesting.desc: This machine makes some pretty useful alloys. It is a good one to have on standby.

betterquesting.name: Mekanism Alloys
betterquesting.desc: These items are used in a lot of recipes.

betterquesting.name: I'll See You in Hell
betterquesting.desc:
Careful now, the Nether is considerably more dangerous than the vanilla nether. There are a lot of new "friends" to meet.

Although the Nether is quite dangerous, there does happen to be a plethora of valuable ores, so you'll just have to decide if the rewards outweigh the risks.

betterquesting.name: Heads Up
betterquesting.desc:
No, this isn't a quest for the Extra Utilities 2 Angel Ring.

This is merely a heads up about the Angel Ring so that you don't go chasing down Ghasts. Just be aware that in this pack, the recipe for the Angel Ring has been changed. Refer to JEI for more information.

betterquesting.name: Making the Drank
betterquesting.desc: Creating Ethanol is the next step on the path to Biodiesel.

betterquesting.name: My New Squeeze
betterquesting.desc: The Immersive Engineering Squeezer is the multiblock structure that is your first step towards biodiesel. Trust me, you are going to want a Diesel Generator because it makes a lot of powah.

betterquesting.name: Bio-Fuel
betterquesting.desc: Finally, we use the Refinery to refine Plant Oil and Ethanol into Biodiesel.

betterquesting.name: The Diesel Generator
betterquesting.desc: This thing is a "BAMF." You might want to have some extra Powercells handy.

betterquesting.name: Quantum Storage
betterquesting.desc:
As you may have noticed, there is no mod that adds a DSU(Deep Storage Unit) in this pack. Instead, there is something much better. There has been a recipe added for Storage Drawers' Creative Storage Upgrade. It's not cheap, but at least you'll be able to hang on to that beautiful array of drawers once it comes time for Deep Storage!

§lNote:§0 You cannot remove a creative upgrade from a drawer once it has been used on that drawer.

§lNote: §0If you want to move a drawer with a creative upgrade in it, be sure to use tape. If you break a drawer that contains a creative upgrade, without tape, you will lose the upgrade.

You have been warned!

§lNote:§0 There has been a mod added that adds a DSU, but the rest of this message is still true. Just a heads up.

betterquesting.name: Enrichment
betterquesting.desc: You're going to want this machine.

betterquesting.name: Enchantatize Me Captain!
betterquesting.desc: The Enchanter is going to be used to make ingredients for everyone's favorite item! It also serves as a lovely enchanter of things.

betterquesting.name: The Old Tinker's Auto-Repair
betterquesting.desc: This is much much better than Mending Moss. If you have enough Mossy Cobblestone, use this instead of Mending Moss.

betterquesting.name: Fluid Manipulation
betterquesting.desc: With these machines, you can melt a lot of things down into liquid form. You're going to want these for making Signalum and Enderium.

betterquesting.name: Thermal Machine Upgrades
betterquesting.desc: Things are a little different in the Thermal world. These upgrades are how you enhance your machines now.

betterquesting.name: Greater Mana Generation
betterquesting.desc:
For this quest, choose §cone§0 of the tasks to complete.§c You do not need to complete all of them.§0

Choose a flower to begin generating even more mana! Check your Lexica Botania for information on these flowers.

betterquesting.name: Functional Flowers
betterquesting.desc:
For this quest, choose §cone§0 of the tasks to complete. §cYou do not need to complete all of them.§0

Functional flowers can be very useful indeed. See the Lexica Botania for more information on functional flowers.

betterquesting.name: The Great Green Steel
betterquesting.desc:
The §9Terrestrial Agglomeration Plate §0is part of a multiblock structure that is used to make one of the strongest materials known to man and elves.

§aTerrasteel§0 is very valuable. It takes a ton of mana to make it; that's why you're going to want those sparks from the previous quest.

betterquesting.name: Spark it Up!
betterquesting.desc: These mystical little items allow you transfer huge amounts of mana in mere seconds. Just place as many Sparks over as many Mana Pools as you would like, then place one over the block that needs large amounts of mana, and -- bam -- near instant mana transfer. Check out the Lexica Botania if more info is needed.

betterquesting.name: A Connection to the Elven Realm
betterquesting.desc:
It's too bad that you can't venture through the Elven Portal, but, be that as it may, it is still a very cool way to turn certain items into other items. Check the Lexica Botania and/or JEI to figure out what items the Elves will trade with you.

§lNote:§0 If you throw something through the portal that doesn't have a trade, the elves are going to keep it, so don't throw your Draconic Staff of Power through expecting to get something awesome in return. (Not speaking from experience of course)

betterquesting.name: The Go Anywhere Do Anything Boxes
betterquesting.desc:
The Strongbox is great because it retains its contents when broken, and it can be upgraded and enchanted to have significantly more storage. Check out JEI for more info.

The Cache also retains its contents when broken. It stores only one type of item, but it will store a lot of that one item. Check out JEI for more info.

Both can be §d§5enchanted §0with the Holding enchantment which adds more storage depending on the level of Holding you put on it.

betterquesting.name: The End... In the Middle?
betterquesting.desc: I think it's safe to assume that you know what you're doing here. If not, go play some vanilla Minecraft.

betterquesting.name: I'd Like to go on a Date Wither.
betterquesting.desc: No doubt it would be more pleasant than fighting the Wither.

betterquesting.name: Modular Dude. Wait... Tubular Dude!
betterquesting.desc:
Modular Storage from RFTools is an excellent way to store your items before you are able to create an ME system.

While this quest only requires a Tier 1 Storage Module, it is definitely recommended to upgrade to Tiers 2 and 3.

betterquesting.name: New EU2 Rings
betterquesting.desc: Extra Utilities 2 has just recently added some fancy new rings which are used on the way to the ever famous Angel Ring.

betterquesting.name: Starting to Auto-Craft
betterquesting.desc: The Autocrafters from RFTools are seriously awesome. They can store a bunch of different recipes, and they can craft very quickly.

betterquesting.name: Spankin' New Kitchen
betterquesting.desc: If you've never used Cooking For Blockheads before, then you are in for a real treat! This mod makes food preparation a breeze, and it looks real nice inside your base.

betterquesting.name: A What in a What?!
betterquesting.desc: A Cow in a Jar is your key to infinite milk. To obtain this item, drop an anvil on top of a cow that is standing on top of a Milk Jar. Easy peasy.

betterquesting.name: Come on Down to Mr. Crayfish's Furniture Store
betterquesting.desc:
Mr. Crayfish makes some nice furniture too. Some of it is even functional! For instance, the Washing Machine can be used to repair your armor!

Even though it doesn't show up in JEI, the recipe for Soapy Water is Soap directly above a Water Bucket.

betterquesting.name: Bookcraft
betterquesting.desc: Bibliocraft is another great decoration mod with a lot of functional decorations. The Bookcase is great for storing all of those mod manuals that seem to take up so much space in every modpack, while the Tool Rack is perfect for storing your tools in a way that you'll have quick access to them if need be.

betterquesting.name: On the way to General Practitioner
betterquesting.desc:
For this quest, choose §cone§0 of the tasks to complete. §cYou do not need to complete both of them.§0

The Resonator is a device you'll use to make different EU2 crafting ingredients. You will need at least 8 GP(Grid Power) in order to use the Resonator, so that is why this quest asks for either a Manual Mill or 8 Solar Panels.

betterquesting.name: Power the Grid
betterquesting.desc:
For this quest, choose §cone§0 of the tasks to complete.§b§c You do not need to complete all of them.

§0In order to use some of the EU2 items and blocks, you need some GP.

betterquesting.name: Osmium Compressor
betterquesting.desc: You'll need this for Refined Obsidian and Glowstone.

betterquesting.name: Shields Up!
betterquesting.desc: This is one righteous device here, dude. It has so much functionality from keeping others out of your base to grinding mobs. The shield projector can do alot.

betterquesting.name: Inscription
betterquesting.desc:
The Applied Energistics Inscriber is the gateway to AE. You use it to make all the basic ME components.

To use the Inscriber, though, you will need inscription plates. These can be found in meteors scattered around the world. The meteors are huge; you can't miss them.

betterquesting.name: You Want These
betterquesting.desc: Yay! No more waiting a century for your quartz seeds to grow! Place 4 of these around a water source, give them power, throw your quartz seeds in the water, and --BAM!-- fast growing Pure Fluix and Pure Certus!

betterquesting.name: Accepting Energy?
betterquesting.desc: You need the Energy Acceptor for a few of Applied Energistic's low level machines.

betterquesting.name: Bu-bu-bu-builder
betterquesting.desc: This machine is so very handy. That's really all I have to say about it.

betterquesting.name: This is a Bugger of a Quest
betterquesting.desc:
HDPE is one of the most tedious materials to make, but once you start cranking it out, it feels highly satisfying.

Check JEI for information on how to make HDPE

betterquesting.name: Suit Up!
betterquesting.desc: Suit up in your favorite armor because you're going to need it. Battling the Gaia Guardian is no walk in the park.

betterquesting.name: OP + OP = Crap
betterquesting.desc: According to the Lexica Botania, Gaia Spirit Ingots are nothing all that special. With that as the case, you are still going to need to make these underwhelming items, as they are used to summon the second tier Gaia Guardian.

betterquesting.name: Gaia Guardian II
betterquesting.desc: This one is considerably tougher than his tier 1 counterpart. The loot he drops is much more spectacular, though.

betterquesting.name: Aesir Rings
betterquesting.desc: Role the Dice of Fate.

betterquesting.name: Control Me
betterquesting.desc: This will be the heart of your ME system. Keep in mind that the more of these you have, the more channels you can potentially have. Also ME Controllers can only connect to other ME Controllers on three sides, and your controller multiblock must stay within a 7x7x7 volume. If either of these rules are broken, the ME system will cease to work until the rules are complied with again.

betterquesting.name: You're Driving ME Nuts!
betterquesting.desc: Make an ME Drive to store all of your Storage Cells.

betterquesting.name: To The Auto-Craft Mobile
betterquesting.desc: Isn't the beginning of autocrafting just exciting?!

betterquesting.name: Cool Looking Storage
betterquesting.desc: These will be used for both regular storage and autocrafting storage.

betterquesting.name: The Core of Autocrafting
betterquesting.desc:
Blank Patterns go into the Pattern Terminal which is where they get turned into the patterns of the items you wish to autocraft.

The Interface will go next to the Molecular Assembler, and the Interface will be what holds the patterns of the items you have set up to autocraft.

betterquesting.name: The Other Core of Autocrafting
betterquesting.desc:
The crafting storage is where items will be kept while they're waiting to be used for a crafting operation. The Co-Processor allows more crafting operations to take place at once, as long as there are multiple sets of Interfaces and Molecular Assemblers for the operations to take place in.

A complete crafting processor is made up of any combination of Crafting Storage blocks and Crafting Co-Processor blocks placed in a rectangular pattern. If you have a valid crafting processor, the appearance of the blocks withing the processor will change. You'll know what I mean when you see it.

betterquesting.name: Dragonaire to Dragonite?
betterquesting.desc: The Draconic Core is probably the most fundamental crafting ingredient in Draconic Evolution

betterquesting.name: Induction Smelter
betterquesting.desc: This is a smelter that takes two ingredients. Crazy right?!

betterquesting.name: Auto-Ores
betterquesting.desc: Environment Tech has 6 different tiers of Void Ore Miners that allow you to gather ores automatically. They come in very handy toward the end game, so that you don't have to mine for the massive amount of materials that some end game items require.

betterquesting.name: Resource Collection
betterquesting.desc: If you've looked at what the Void Resource Miner collects, in JEI, then you might think, "I don't need that thing." If you want to progress further into Environmental Tech's ore miners and solar panels, then you will need this thing. Among the mostly useless resources that the Void Resource Miner collects, it acquires a material called Mica. Mica is the resource you will need for the high tier Environmental Tech machines.

betterquesting.name: Extreme Passive Generation
betterquesting.desc: The Environmental Tech solar arrays can generate a lot of power, especially the high tier solar arrays.

betterquesting.name: Ultimate Ore Gathering
betterquesting.desc: The Void Ore Miner Tier 6 is a monster when it comes to collecting ores out of thin air!

betterquesting.name: Resources are Flying In!
betterquesting.desc: This Resource Miner is so powerful that it can collect Nether Stars. That's right, Nether Stars.

betterquesting.name: Ultimate Passive Generation
betterquesting.desc: So. Much. Power.

betterquesting.name: The Moment You've All Been Waiting For
betterquesting.desc:
For this quest, choose §cone§0 of the tasks to complete. §cYou do not need to complete all of them.§0

I would imagine this item needs no explanation, but just in case, the Angel Ring gives you creative flight while it is in your inventory. Also, you must have at least 32 grid power in order for it to work. In case you missed it somehow, Grid Power is explaned in the "Somewhere in the Middle" quest line.

betterquesting.name: Gotta Grind Em' All
betterquesting.desc: This block will one shot any mob that you throw at it. Here's a hint, it is great for a Nether Star farm.

betterquesting.name: Becoming a Wyvern
betterquesting.desc: The Wyvern Core is a crafting ingredient for higher tier Draconic Evolution items.

betterquesting.name: Pikachu! I Fuse You!
betterquesting.desc:
Fusion crafting is what's going to open the door to many OP things.

The fusion crafting setup is pretty simple. Check out the Draconic Evolution Information Tablet if you need any help.

§lNote:§0 This quest only calls for 9 Basic Fusion Crafting Injectors, but you are definitely going to want more than that. Fusion crafting recipes can have any number of ingredients, and you will need an injector per ingredient.

betterquesting.name: The Fusing of the Wyverns
betterquesting.desc: This is the next tier of fusion crafting.

betterquesting.name: Wake me up Before you Fuse Fuse
betterquesting.desc: That was bad and I should feel bad.

betterquesting.name: Chaotic Fusion
betterquesting.desc: The highest tier of fusion crafting.

betterquesting.name: I Forced Myself Awake
betterquesting.desc: You're getting up there! You've worked so hard. Don't give up now. You're almost OP!

betterquesting.name: Draconic Employees of Power
betterquesting.desc: If you want the Ultimate all-in-one weapon/tool, then this is the staff for you!! Seriously, this thing rocks. If you've never used it before, then you're in for a treat.

betterquesting.name: Kay. Os. Dra. Gon.
betterquesting.desc:
This dragon is no joke. I'm not joking about it not being a joke, either. In all seriousness, before you go fight the Chaos Guardian, you are going to need to make sure you're fully decked out in Draconic Armor. It will also help to have that armor upgraded to Draconic level in every stat.

Once the battle has started, you're going to need to keep moving fast(up your flight speed in the Draconic Armor config GUI). You don't want to ever stand still for more than a second at a time because the Guardian's attacks will catch you and kill you(yes, even if you're in full Draconic Armor). 

After you've taken out all of the crystals, shoot your Draconic Bow like a madman at the Guardian, while still moving at top speed. §a§2Look out for a green projectile that the dragon may shoot; §0that green projectile revives a crystal. If a crystal is revived, you will have to kill it again before you'll be able to damage the Chaos Guardian. 

Good luck.

betterquesting.name: Shards of Chaos
betterquesting.desc: Highest level crafting ingredients.

betterquesting.name: The Core of all Chaos
betterquesting.desc: Chaotic Core. What more can be said?

betterquesting.name: So Make it Fun
betterquesting.desc:
It is now the age ofExtended Crafting and ProjectE! Just a little more grind left, and then it's all coast. Enjoy it.

We will start with Extended Crafting, and Extended Crafting will pave the way for ProjectE. ProjectE will, in turn, pave the way for a more OP you. Who wouldn't like a more OP them?

betterquesting.name: More Than One at a Time!
betterquesting.desc:
Make this inscriber as soon as you can afford it. Seriously.

§lNote:§0 Unlike the Inscriber, you will need the Energy Acceptor for the Advanced Inscriber.

betterquesting.name: Better Crystal Growth
betterquesting.desc: Just like with the Advanced Inscriber, make this block as soon as you can afford it. Seriously.

betterquesting.name: Runnin' Hog Wild with Cables
betterquesting.desc:
For this quest, pick §cone§0 of the tasks to complete.§c You do not need to complete both of them.§0

These connect various parts of your ME network to each other.

betterquesting.name: Upgrade ME Please
betterquesting.desc: Applied Energistics 2 has some pretty nifty upgrades for their devices.

betterquesting.name: Sorcerer's Stone ;P
betterquesting.desc: This is the fundamental magical device of ProjectE. It is what allows you to make more powerful magical devices that allow for equivalent matter exchanges. I'm pretty sure that's what EMC stands for, but anyway, it is a very powerful form of magic indeed. Just follow the remaining quests, and you shant be lead astray.

betterquesting.name: Elitist Crafting Pig!
betterquesting.desc:
The Elite Crafting Table is the next step in the Extended Crafting path.

§lNote: §0Anything that can be crafted on the Advanced Crafting table can be crafted on the Elite Crafting Table, so there's no reason, really, to keep the lower tier tables around once you have the higher tier tables.

betterquesting.name: First Taste of EMC
betterquesting.desc:
This will be your first taste of EMC. Basically, you choose a target item in the top-left corner, then you 'burn' items in the condenser's inventory. Once you have burned enough items whose total EMC is equal to the EMC of the target item, then you will recieve the target item. I'm probably making it sound complicated, but trust me, it's easy.

§lExample:§0 For the second choice reward, you can choose either a Block of Emerald or a Nether Star. Both of these have equivalent EMC values. If you were to choose a Nether Star as your target item, and then you 'burned' a Block of Emerald, you would receive 1 Nether Star.

betterquesting.name: Introducing the iCondenser 2
betterquesting.desc: New and improved. All jokes aside, this Energy Condenser really is a step up.

betterquesting.name: The Ultimate Table
betterquesting.desc: More like the tedious table amirite? Don't worry, only the most powerful of items will be crafted on this table.

betterquesting.name: Conversion Catalog
betterquesting.desc:
No more selecting a target, and then burning your items. Now, you just keep this stocked with EMC, and you'll be able to get out of it anything that you've ever put into it. Also, The Tome of Knowledge, if burned in the Transmutation Table or Tablet, will unlock every existing EMC item.

§lNote:§0 You can pick up the Transmutation Table without losing your stored knowledge and EMC.

betterquesting.name: Transmutation, Anywhere you Go
betterquesting.desc: Exactly what the title says. You should have ProjectE pretty well down by this point.

betterquesting.name: Free EMC
betterquesting.desc: Plop an Anti-Matter Relay in between an Energy Collector and an Energy Condenser, and -Viola!- you're making FREE EMC! WOOOOO!

betterquesting.name: Ultimate Singularity
betterquesting.desc: At this point, there's really no reason for you to do this quest, except to just be a badass. I'm hoping in the future, to add some extra special items that use these extremely late game items. (We'll just have to wait for Contenttweaker to get a little more of the bugs worked out.)

betterquesting.name: Dracula of the Trees
betterquesting.desc: Here is where you can get started with Industrial Foregoing. The Tree Fluid Extractor is your most fundamental item within the mod, so start by placing it down in front of a log. It doesn't even need power to gather that delicious tree juice!

betterquesting.name: Rubber, if you Dare
betterquesting.desc: Rubber is what you'll use to make plastic, which will come in very handy on your way through Industrial Foregoing.

betterquesting.name: Plasticity
betterquesting.desc: Plastic plastic plastic. It's used in basically every recipe in this mod.

betterquesting.name: The Industrial Case
betterquesting.desc: This Machine Case is used for all of the more advanced Industrial Foregoing machines.

betterquesting.name: The Black Hole Unit
betterquesting.desc: It's for deep storage!

betterquesting.name: The Black Hole Tank
betterquesting.desc: Deep storage of liquids!

betterquesting.name: Controller of Black Holes
betterquesting.desc: This thing can hold 9 Black Hole Units! You can input and output from all 9 units using just one controller! It's pretty nifty if I do say so.

betterquesting.name: 3x Furnace
betterquesting.desc: This is a powered furnace that smelts 3 items at once. Neat.

betterquesting.name: Extractor of Enchantments
betterquesting.desc: This will, for the cost of power, remove the enchantment from an enchanted item and place it onto an empty book. It'll come in handy if you have a lot of random enchanted armor laying around.

betterquesting.name: Powered Mob Spawner
betterquesting.desc:
This block is exactly what the title says it is. To use it, capture a mob in a Mob Imprisonment Tool, then put the tool into the Mob Duplicator. Give the duplicator power and liquid essence, and it will start to spawn duplicates of the mob that you captured. Simple right?

If you're wondering, liquid essence comes from either the Mob Crusher or the Resourceful Furnace. The Mob Crusher is the more effecient way for sure, though.

betterquesting.name: Crushing the Mobs
betterquesting.desc: Give this machine power, and it will give you drops of the mobs it kills and liquid essence. It kills mobs in a 5x5 area in front of it.

betterquesting.name: The New Ranch Hands
betterquesting.desc: These machines all have to do with animals. The feeder will automatically feed animals, at the cost of power. The rancher can milk cows and shear sheep, at the cost of power. While powered, the Animal Sewage collects sewage from animals above it. The Sewage Composter creates fertilizer out of liquid sewage. It's a pretty gross concept, but the fertilizer comes in handy, and it's a crafting ingredient for a neat machine.

betterquesting.name: Hydration Station
betterquesting.desc: If the Hydrator isn't given power, then it acts as a water source, and it will keep nearby farmland hydrated. If given power, it will increase crop growth speed in addition to keeping farmland hydrated.

betterquesting.name: Slime that is Pink
betterquesting.desc: Pink slime, the item, comes from pink slimes, the mobs. Pink slime mobs are created by placing liquid pink slime in the world, and after a few seconds, the liquid pink slime will turn into a pink slime mob.

betterquesting.name: Mob Slaughter Factory
betterquesting.desc: Pretty gruesome name, no? Well this is basically the same as the Mob Crusher, except it doesn't collect mob drops. When a mob is killed by the slaughter factory, it produces liquid meat and has a chance of producing liquid pink slime.

betterquesting.name: Stonework Factory
betterquesting.desc: This machine is really cool. Check it out in the Industrial Foregoing manual. The author does a great job of explaining what it does.

betterquesting.name: Green Thumbed Machines
betterquesting.desc: These machines will help you tend your crops. The sower plants, the fertilizer fertilizes, and the gatherer harvests. All three use power to do what they do.

betterquesting.name: Processing Ores
betterquesting.desc: With this handy little machine, you will be able to process all of the ores that you obtain through void mining. Giving the ore processor liquid essence allows it to process ores using fortune!

betterquesting.name: Automate the Game of Life
betterquesting.desc:
Can you figure out how to use all of these items to automate the game of life?

If you need a little help, check out this YouTube tutorial: §9https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IctPPVuHPkw§0.
When it's automated the way it is in that video, it looks so cool. You should feel pretty good once you put this together.

Once you have it automated, go ahead and check the box in the second task. It doesn't have to be automated the same way it is in the video, just as long as you can gather mana automatically using the Dandelifeon.

betterquesting.name: Dank Null, Dude
betterquesting.desc: This is the continuation of the /dev/null from Open Blocks. You choose which items you want in it, then whenever you pick up those items, they go into the /Dank/Null. The items you select will start being voided once they reach the stack limit for the /Dank/Null you're using.

betterquesting.name: Dank Mk. 2
betterquesting.desc: This is the second iteration of the /Dank/Null. It has more slots and a higher stack limit per slot.

betterquesting.name: Danker
betterquesting.desc: Tier 3 /Dank/Null.

betterquesting.name: Dankerer
betterquesting.desc: Tier 4 /Dank/Null.

betterquesting.name: Dankest
betterquesting.desc: Tier 5 /Dank/Null.

betterquesting.name: Dankestest
betterquesting.desc: Tier 6 /Dank/Null.

betterquesting.name: The End is What You Make It
Challenges
betterquesting.desc: This will be an ongoing quest line. As I think of more challenges, I will add them to this.
